channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report E-2023080920
item.description:
Report E-2023080920

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 15, 2023, six (6) 1-gallon containers of UN2735 were damaged during loading and released approximately one (1) gallon to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents and pads to the release. The crew contained all UN2735-impacted material in two (2) 30-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080770
item.description:
Report E-2023080770

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 8, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3265 was damaged due to an unsecure bung and released approximately half of one (.5) gallon of product to the drum and trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel resecured the bung and deployed neutralizer to the release. The crew then used absorbent pads to collect all loose product. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023080530
item.description:
Report E-2023080530

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 28, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing UN3266 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted surfaces. The one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum was placed into one (1) poly overpack.HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the corrosive-liquid impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and miscellaneous cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023080347
item.description:
Report X-2023080347

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: BUFORD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: EMPLOYEE HEARD PACKAGE HISSING, EMPLOYEES QUICKLY VACATED TRUCK, SUPERVISOR CLEARED THE AREA OF EMPLOYEES WHILE CALLING FOR HAZMAT RESPONDER. RMP QUICKLY RESPONDED, WEARING PPE AND USING THE DECISION TREE, RESPONDER LOCATED A LOOSE VALVE THAT WAS LEAKING GAS. RESPONDER CLOSED VALVE AND PACKAGE STOPPED HISSING. PACKAGE AND SPILL WAS CLEANED UP FOLLOWING THE RESPONSE SHEET AND BROUGHT TO DMP AREA.

item.title: Report I-2023080020
item.description:
Report I-2023080020

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: Doraville
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 6 / 30 / 23 at 9 : 43 pm a leaking package caught fire in the load area of the Pleasantdale facility. An employee found the package on a graSng between bays 235 & 236 loading doors. An employee pulled the fire alarm at 9 : 43 pm. signaling for a building evacuation.The package was extinguished by a mechanic and an operations supervisor. 398 employees wore evacuated and no injuries were reported. After 13 minutes the fire was extinguished and the employees reentered the building at 21 : 56.

item.title: Report X-2023070005
item.description:
Report X-2023070005

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: Chambllee
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Tank car GBRX702039 was found leaking from the BOV by an FRA inspector. Upon inspection by a contractor, the drip was product trapped in the BOV cap and leaked due to a misaligned gasket in the cap. The BOV was inspected, the BOV cap gasket was realigned and the cap was secured.
